intro: Seriphidium botschantzevii, commonly known as the Botchanzev's wormwood, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its wiry stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Seriphidium botschantzevii is adapted to withstand drought and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
